Published text: WFP and UNICEF now say five members were killed, several more injured in earlier attack on aid convoy near Al Koma, Sudan; multiple trucks burned
"Multiple casualties" after WFP and UNICEF convoy delivering food from Al Koma into El Fasher, Sudan, came "under attack" overnight, UN representative tells Reuters; no additional details provided

Editor's note: We are monitoring reports of all exits and entrance routes to Wadi Halfa in north Sudan, blocked by protesters demonstrating against scheduled power cuts since midnight. Local media earlier reported that crowds gathered outside the city's electricity office on Sunday to protest cuts that started on Saturday amid a worsening heatwave. We will update accordingly. - Halima
More than 2,700 families displaced by fighting in al-Khowi, Sudan, between May 29-30 following takeover by paramilitary Rapid Support Forces, according to UN migration agency
Hospital in al-Koma, Sudan, says some 89 people killed and injured in earlier drone strike near market area, blaming army warplanes
Sudan's transitional Prime Minister Kamil Idriss dissolves government, tasks secretaries of ministries with undertaking responsibilities until new government formed, day after taking oath
Sudan's health ministry says 12 deaths and 727 cholera cases identified across the country as of May 31 [corrects date]
Sudan doctors union says three children and an adult killed, and four other people injured, in RSF attack on the Shagra area of El Fasher
Sudanese local media reports new military shelling targeting RSF facilities in the north of Nyala Friday night and Saturday morning
More: Sudanese government claims Wednesday RSF drone strikes on El Khawi, West Kordofan, and Al-Dabaibat, South Kordofan, killed eight and two civilians, respectively
Sudanese government claims Thursday-morning RSF strike on hospital in El Obeid killed at least 16 patients and wounded several other visitors and staff
WHO reports 2.9 million doses of oral vaccine against cholera arrived in Port Sudan, Sudan, to help combat outbreak in Khartoum and North Kordofan states
Update: Sudan Doctors Network says at least six civilians killed and 14 others injured in earlier RSF attack on hospital in El Obeid
Report: At least five people killed and 10 others injured in early morning RSF shelling on Sudan's El Obeid Hospital, health sources tell Al Jazeera
Sudan health authorities announce the closure of main hospital in El Obeid until further notice after it sustained damage in suspected RSF attack on Thursday morning
Al-Jazeera: Sudan's Rapid Support Forces paramilitary group struck the Social Security Hospital in El Obeid, North Kordofan; no word on damage or injury
Sudan People's Liberation Movementâ€“North militant group accuses military of burning in early May eight villages in the Heiban area of South Kordofan
At least 70 people died in Khartoum, Sudan, as of Wednesday amid ongoing cholera outbreak, health officials report
Sudan's health ministry reports 25 cholera-related deaths and more than 900 infections in Khartoum on Tuesday
Two people killed, four others injured in attack in Khor Delib, South Sudan, authorities say
At least two people killed and four others injured by suspected gunmen on Monday in the city of Torit, South Sudan, authorities say; investigation ongoing
RSF militia forces hit an army headquarters and fuel depot with a drone strike in Kosti with fatalities reported, unconfirmed reports say
Local media reports at least six people killed after strike Friday near a mosque in El Fasher, Sudan
At least five people killed, 1,000 others have been displaced following three days of heavy rain in Unity State, South Sudan, local media says
Sudanese army regains control of Al-Dabaibat area north of Dilling, South Kordofan, Al Arabiya reports; no official word from military
US to impose sanctions on Sudan after finding army used chemical weapons in 2024 during conflict with RSF forces; limits on U.S. exports, government lines of credit expected to take effect in June
Sudanese army says 465 bodies discovered in mass graves in Salha area of Omdurman as force clears areas previously held by RSF militia; hundreds of captives also freed
Federal judge rules Trump administration violated court order after sudden deportation flight to South Sudan earlier this week
Sudan's army claims it has regained complete control of Khartoum after expelling remaining RSF forces on Tuesday
Sudanese official says RSF's Port Sudan drone attacks carried out with logistical support form UAE ships in the Red Sea
Video: Smoke seen rising over Omdurman as Sudan army wages battle for control of Khartoum State
Explosions, clashes reported in Omdurman, Sudan, as army says operation underway to drive RSF from remaining positions in Khartoum State

Editor's note: Military sources have told Al Jazeera that Khartoum State, Sudan, has been recaptured in full from the RSF militia by the army. A short while ago an official said that the Sudan army was "close" to recapturing all of Khartoum State, but there was also still fighting reported in Omdurman. We will update when we have a citable source confirming the army is claiming to have retaken the whole state. -Sarah
Sudan army official says "large-scale operation" ongoing to reclaim all of Khartoum state as fighting with RSF continues in south and west of Omdurman
Report: Rapid Support Forces "target" University of Khartoum in Omdurman, Sudan, with explosive drones, sources tell Al Jazeera
Explosions heard after drone sighted over city in Port Sudan, reports local media citing eyewitnesses; no word on injured or damage
Sudan Doctors Union says at least 19 people killed and 28 others injured in RSF attacks in El Fasher and Abu Shouk Camp in North Darfur so far on Sunday
Sudanese army targets apparent RSF positions in the Salha area of Omdurman, according to Al Jazeera correspondent
Residents of Khartoum entering third day of widespread power cuts following long-range RSF drone strikes on power stations near Sudanese capital on Wednesday
Sudan accuses UAE of violating international convention by "expelling most of the staff" of the Sudanese Consulate General in Dubai in recent days
Suspected RSF drones reportedly attacked Merowe in Sudan's Northern State overnight, local media reports; no word on damage or injuries
One student killed, three more injured in accidental ordnance explosion at a school in Sudan's Wad Madani, local media reports
Two UNMISS staff killed in shooting involving military peacekeeper at mission's base in Malakal, South Sudan, on Tuesday, officials report; investigation underway

Editor's note: Al Arabiya is reporting that more than a dozen people were killed in a suspected RSF attack at the Abu Shouk camp in El Fasher, Sudan. It is unclear when the attack took place. We are looking for corroboration. -Jessica
Power outage reported in Khartoum, Sudan, after three power stations bombed by suspected RSF drones in Omdurman, local media reports
Rapid Support Forces conduct drone attack on El Obeid in Sudan's North Kordofan region, reports Al Jazeera citing military source
Three Sudanese armed groups join forces to form militia to protect Sudan's Um Gargour eastern border area with Eritrea
Sudanese refugee kidnapped by Russian mercenaries in Birao refugee camp on Friday, reports say
Sudan's army says seven people killed, 15 more injured in RSF drone and artillery attacks near El Fasher as fighting continues for control of North Darfur; exact time of bombings unclear
Up to 12 people killed, more injured in armed attack in Rumbek North county in South Sudan's Lakes State on Sunday morning, local media reports; perpetrators reportedly from nearby Unity State

Editor's note: Local media is reporting that the Sudanese government has drafted contingency plans to suspend the import and export of oil from South Sudan in the event of further RSF strikes to destabilize the oil transit system. Recent drone strikes have impacted pump stations, depots and port facilities on the Red Sea. Radio Tamazuj is reporting that a letter, dated Friday, showed the Sudanese government warning South Sudan that they would be unable to facilitate the export of South Sudanese oil from Port Sudan if the transportation system was further compromised. They describe the risk as high, and the contingency plans as "fast track." We will keep an eye out for any reports of further disruption along key exchange routes. -Sarah
Syrian government will send representatives to Sudan to assess conditions for refugees and make necessary evacuations, says foreign minister, citing order of Interim President Ahmed al-Sharaa
Local media says fires at ports of Port Sudan have been extinguished after more than four days
Sudanese army recaptures town of Al-Khawi in South Kordofan region, Al Jazeera reports citing unnamed military source
Sudanese army repels attempted RSF drone attack against Atbara airport and additional targets in Port Sudan, local media reports citing sources
Sudan army airstrikes target Rapid Support Force positions in Nyala and El Geneina areas of Darfur, sources tell local media
Sudanese civil defense says all fires at major oil depots in government-controlled Port Sudan are now "completely" under control following numerous RSF attacks on petroleum reserves
More: Sudan state media says rSF drone strike on prison in El Obeid took place Saturday morning
Sudanese state media reports situation at prison struck by RSF in El Obeid is under control; strike killed at least 20 people and injured 45 more, official says
Sudanese media reports army has made gains against RSF in west Omdurman
Anti-aircraft fire reported after drone spotted near Port Sudan, according to local media; no specific location given
Sudanese media reports drone attack on Atbara in River Nile state
Sudanese doctors union: At least 21 people killed and 47 others in alleged RSF paramilitary group strike on a prison in city of Obeid in North Kurdufan; exact timing of attack unclear
Report: At least 14 people killed in suspected paramilitary Rapid Support Forces airstrike on a displaced people's camp in the Darfur region of Sudan, aid workers tell AFP on Saturday

Editor's note: Al Jazeera is reporting, citing unnamed sources, that more than a dozen people were killed and several others injured after a suspected RSF drone targeted prison in El Obeid, Sudan. Local media or officials are yet to confirm details, with only one local source reporting on the attack, without providing further details. We are following the situation closely. -Jessica
Sudanese media video shows anti-aircraft fire in Port Sudan during earlier drone attack
Sudanese army deploys anti-aircraft weapons to combat drone attack on Port Sudan, Al-Jazeera reports; no specific location given
Sudanese media report new drone attack on Port Sudan with no specific location given; air defense reported at work
New RSF drone strikes reported on Port Sudan, Sudan, by local media with no word on specific location
Al Jazeera correspondent reports Sudanese anti-aircraft systems have activated in response to drones in Port Sudan; exact location not immediately clear
At least three people reported killed in suspected RSF attack on a march in Omdurman, Sudan

Editor's note: We are seeing reports from AFP, citing a military source, that another drone attack is underway at a naval base in Port Sudan. Port Sudan was hit by an apparent drone wave late on Wednesday and footage showed smoke and anti-aircraft fire. We continue to search for corroboration on reports of attacks on Port Sudan. - James
Al Jazeera reports explosions near oil depots in Kosti, Sudan; no further details yet available
Sudanese Air Force College in Port Sudan struck during earlier drone barrage, Al Hadath reports
Video shows smoke plumes, anti-aircraft fire in the skies over Port Sudan, Sudan, amid apparent RSF drone wave
Al-Jazeera reports new drone strikes on Port Sudan, Sudan, late Wednesday, with sounds of anti-aircraft networks attempting to intercept them
Sudanese army says its anti-aircraft systems intercepted drones targeting naval base in Port Sudan earlier Wednesday
Sudanese media reports three blasts were heard during earlier drone attack on Port Sudan; no immediate word on damage
Sudanese media reports new drone strikes on unspecified areas in Port Sudan
Sudanese energy ministry says petroleum supply remains stable despite Rapid Support Force attacks on fuel depots in Port Sudan
South Sudan's president announces sweeping reshuffle of key state government positions in Upper Nile, Central Equatoria, and Warrap states amid increasing political instability
Sudanese armed forces say that they killed "dozens" of RSF fighters and destroyed significant equipment during fighting in the south of Al Fashir on Monday
Sudanese electric utility company says there is a total power outage in the city of Port Sudan after energy infrastructure was damaged by RSF paramilitary drone attacks earlier Tuesday
Somali national reportedly killed in armed attack on highway connecting Juba and Terekeka in South Sudan, officials say
Fire and smoke still seen rising from port in city of Port Sudan after suspected Rapid Support Forces drone attack; a power station south of the city was damaged in a separate strike
Airport official at Port Sudan, Sudan, confirms to local media all flights suspended after wave of RSF paramilitary drone attacks in the city
RSF paramilitary forces are reportedly using advanced foreign air defense systems in the El Fasher, North Darfur, South Darfur and Nyala regions, according to local media
Suspected RSF drone attack damages Marina Hotel in Port Sudan, Sudan, according to local media; no injuries reported from the attack thus far
Al Jazeera: All flights suspended at airport in Port Sudan, Sudan, following wave of RSF paramilitary drone attacks in the city overnight
Large fire burning at warehouses in vicinity of harbour in Sudanese city of Port Sudan after apparent drone strike follows attack on airport, local journalist reports
Al Jazeera reports Sudanese civil defense working to contain fire burning at Port Sudan International Airport following apparent drone strike

Editor's note: We are monitoring after an apparent drone strike caused a fire at the international airport in Port Sudan, Sudan. One report suggests that the target was a fuel depot at the airport. There is no word on injuries. An Al Arabiya correspondent says the strike hit near the civilian terminal, causing cancellation of flights. This follows a day after the Sudanese military said that air traffic had resumed at the airport after the facility was attacked by an RSF drone on Sunday. We will update as things develop. - Halima
Video: Large fire burning at international airport in Port Sudan, Sudan, following apparent drone strike, according to journalist; no immediate word from officials
Smoke seen rising, explosions heard at international airport in Port Sudan, Sudan, Al Jazeera, Al Arabiya report
Video shows heavy column of smoke rising from fuel depot south of Port Sudan, Sudan; no confirmation from officials yet on cause

Editor's note: Pro-government Sudanese media outlet Sudan Akhbar are alleging that the fire burning at an oil refinery in Port Sudan was sparked by an RSF drone attack. They do not provide a source for this claim, instead claiming to have access to eyewitness videos not linked in the article. The allegation would track with yesterday's RSF attack on the Port Sudan airport and nearby military base. We are watching for confirmation of RSF's involvement in the fire. - Owen
Suspected RSF drones shot down while targeting government controlled airport in Kassala, Sudan, for third straight day, according to local media
Fire south of Port Sudan, Sudan, is burning at petroleum products warehouse, reports Al Jazeera citing unnamed sources

Editor's note: We are aware of images circulating on social media of a large fire burning at multiple oil depots in Port Sudan, Sudan. The attack has not yet been reported on by Sudanese media, and the cause of the fires is still unclear. The fires come just one day after a series of RSF paramilitary drone strikes in the city, which were the first of the country's two year civil war. We are watching our sources for more information. - Owen

Sudanese military say that air traffic has resumed at airport in Port Sudan after the facility was attacked by an RSF drone on Sunday; Sudanese general say they shot down most of the drones launched at the city
Sudanese media says RSF paramilitaries arrested multiple people in the city of Nyala in connection to Saturday's deadly attack on the airport
Report: Air raid strikes el-Obeid, Sudan, according to Al Jazeera citing local sources
Sudanese army anti-aircraft weapons reportedly repel Rapid Support Forces drones attack near Kassala Airport in country's east, local media reports
Sudanese media video appears to show large explosion in Port Sudan after RSF drone strike; military confirmed ammunition depot struck causing "scattered explosions"
More: Sudanese military claims "limited damage" after reported RSF drone struck ammunition depot, causing "scattered explosions" in Port Sudan, Sudan

Editor's note: We have issued a correction to a previous item that stated an RSF drone attack struck the Osman Digna port in Port Sudan, Sudan. Military missives claim that a facility called the "Osman Digna Air Base" was struck, but it is unclear where that location is, with neither of the city's airports readily identifiable as a base by that name. - Matthew
Sudanese military claims no injuries after RSF drone attack on air base, infrastructure on Port Sudan, Sudan, believed to be the first such attack of the civil war

Sudanese military, citing official, reports drone attack on Port Sudan targeted civilian facilities including air base and a cargo warehouse; unverified reports claim power outages in parts of city [corrects location struck]
Sudanese media photos show smoke plumes over Port Sudan, Sudan, following reported RSF drone attack on airport there; no reports yet of damage or injury
Al-Jazeera reports five-drone attack on Port Sudan International Airport in Port Sudan, Sudan; no word on possible damage or injury yet

Sudanese military claims to have destroyed a plane Saturday carrying supplies, materiel, and drones to the RSF in Nyala, inflicting casualties on its crew; alleges the plane was a Boeing of Emirati origin
Sudan's government claims RSF killed 300 civilians in city of En Nahud
Update: MSF reports seven people killed, 20 others injured in Saturday bombing of its hospital in Old Fangak, South Sudan
Sudan's rebel RSF captures town of Al-Khawi, South Kordofan province, as rival army forces retreat toward El Obeid, Al-Arabiya reports
Sudan Doctors' Union says at least 11 people killed and four others injured in fighting between RSF militants and army in Salha area of Omdurman
MSF says deaths and injuries reported after organization's hospital bombed in Old Fangak, South Sudan; NGO says facility was last functional one in area
Unnamed Sudanese military sources claim to have bombed RSF weapons and fuel stockpiles at Nyala Airport

Editor's note: A Twitter/X account claiming to represent the South Sudanese ethnic Nuer militant group Naath Defense Forces said that the government of South Sudan launched airstrikes on Nuer civilian areas in Old Fangak and nearby villages beginning early this morning. We have not yet seen reports surface in local media. We are monitoring for further information. - Theresa
Local media video appears to show people fleeing Nahud in West Kordofan, Sudan, amid clashes that has seen RSF paramilitary reportedly seize city
Sudan's government accuses RSF of killing civilians, attacking public buildings and looting in En Nahud after army forces lost control of town
Video: Sudan's rebel RSF releases inmates from prison in city of En Nahud after capture from rival army forces
Chadian armed forces say an armed group from Darfur, Sudan, has been disarmed and detained at border post in Bahai
At least 15 people killed, more than a dozen injured in inter-communal violence in Tonj South area of Warrap, South Sudan, on Thursday, local official says
At least 19 people dead, 37 more injured in Nahud, West Kordofan, after Rapid Support Forces laid siege to Sudan army positions on Thursday, Al Jazeera reports
Sudanese military denies reports they have lost control of West Kordofan's Nahud town
Sudanese media reports rebel RSF captured town of En Nahud, South Kordofan state, following sustained attack on army forces

Editor's note: We are aware of a report on Al Arabiya, citing a Sudanese army source, saying that defenses remain in place in the city of Nahud in the south of the country. The report appears to come in response to footage circulating on social media platforms purportedly showing Rapid Support Forces militia in front of local administration headquarters in the city. A similar report from Al Jazeera says that a military garrison in Nahud is holding out against RSF attack. We continue to monitor for further updates. - James
Rapid Support Forces attack city of Nahud in Sudan's South Kordofan province, reports Al Jazeera citing military source
Sudanese local media reports RSF drone strike on military base in Kosti, White Nile state and report casualties among government soldiers
Al Jazeera reports explosions rock town of Kosti, Sudan; no further information provided
